CatDescriptText: Related image published in advertisement in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 25, 1950, pg. 5, text reads: "Jackie Robinson Baseball Jacket...First at Pittsburgh Mercantile Co. $6.98 In boys' sizes 8 to 18. Here's the baseball jacket all the boys are going to be wild about...the new Jackie Robinson jacket!  It has a picture of All-Star Jackie Robinson (voted the National League's most valuable player in 1949), screen printed on the back.  This keen-looking jacket is made of water-resistant rayon-satin tackle twill, with warm cotton kasha lining.  It has a smooth working Talon zipper front, two slash pockets, knit bottom and cuff, and set-in sleeves.  Comes in bright two-tone combinations of of blue with gold, black with gold, red with gold, purple with gold, or green with gold...."
TitMainTitle: Boy mannequin wearing varsity style jacket with Jackie Robinson logo on back, standing in front of light colored basket weave fabric panel, another version
